rev.diff:
Line 146: Line 146:
===Scott Campbell shooting===
===Scott Campbell shooting===
  +
{{ external media
  +
| align = right
  +
| width =
  +
| video1= "[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I0pX9LeE-g8 Shot by police with rubber bullet at Occupy Oakland]" Filmed by Oakland resident Scott Campbell, moments before being shot by an Oakland Police officer.
  +
}}
  +
Shortly before 1am on November 3, Oakland resident Scott Campbell was shot by police using a [[Non-lethal_weapon#Ammunition|less-lethal round]] while he was filming a stationary line of police in riot gear, hours after the [[2011 Oakland general strike]]. The apparently-unprovoked shooting was documented by the resulting point-of-view video from Campbell's own camera.<ref name=Cambell>[http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-57321440/experts-occupy-vid-shows-excessive-force/ Experts: "Occupy" video shows excessive force]</ref> Geoffrey Alpert, a criminal justice professor from the University of South Carolina said watching a video of the incident left him "astonished, amazed and embarrassed" and that "unless there's something we don't know, that's one of the most outrageous uses of a firearm that I've ever seen."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/top-stories/ci_19284774|accessdate=Nov 7, 2011}}</ref>
Shortly before 1am on November 3, Oakland resident Scott Campbell was shot by police using a [[Non-lethal_weapon#Ammunition|less-lethal round]] while he was filming a stationary line of police in riot gear, hours after the [[2011 Oakland general strike]]. The apparently-unprovoked shooting was documented by the resulting point-of-view video from Campbell's own camera.<ref name=Cambell>[http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-57321440/experts-occupy-vid-shows-excessive-force/ Experts: "Occupy" video shows excessive force]</ref> Geoffrey Alpert, a criminal justice professor from the University of South Carolina said watching a video of the incident left him "astonished, amazed and embarrassed" and that "unless there's something we don't know, that's one of the most outrageous uses of a firearm that I've ever seen."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/top-stories/ci_19284774|accessdate=Nov 7, 2011}}</ref>
